patterns: Tell me about Haldia Institute of Technology
responses: Haldia Institute of Technology (HIT) is an autonomous engineering institute in Haldia, West Bengal, India.
It is approved by AICTE and affiliated with MAKAUT.
HIT offers B.Tech, M.Tech, MCA, and MBA courses.
The campus includes administrative blocks, academic blocks, student hostels, library, and various facilities.

patterns: Courses at Haldia Institute of Technology
responses: HIT offers 13 B.Tech, 5 M.Tech, MCA, and MBA courses.
Courses are available in various disciplines such as Engineering, Applied Sciences, Humanities, Chemical, Food & BioTechnology, Electronics, Computer & Informatics, and Management & Social Sciences.
Haldia Institute of Technology is accredited by NAAC with an 'A' grade in 2018 with a CGPA of 3.31 on a 4-point scale.
Most of the courses are provisionally accredited by NBA.

HIT has a campus of approximately 37 acres with administrative blocks, academic blocks, student hostels, library, departmental store, post office, laundry, medical store, bank, ATM, restaurant, open-air cafeteria, and recreational building.
Sports facilities include a football ground, basketball court, and cricket ground.

patterns: Hostel facilities at Haldia Institute of Technology
responses: HIT provides separate housing facilities (hostels) for boys and girls.
Boys Hostels: Newton Hall of Residence, Galileo Hall of Residence, Ranichak Boys Hostel, Balaji Boys Hostel.
Girls Hostels: Tamalika Ponda Seth Hall of Residence, Matangini Hall of Residence.

The hostel fee is around 12,000 rupees per semester, which is around 2,000 rupees per month. This is for lodging only. There is also a 5,000 rupee kasul fee that is returned after completing the degree . The mess at Haldia Institute of Technology (HIT) offers a variety of food at different prices. Students pay for what they eat at the end of the month.

patterns: Academic departments at Haldia Institute of Technology
responses: HIT has schools and departments including School of Engineering, School of Applied Sciences & Humanities, School of Chemical, Food & BioTechnology, and School of Electronics, Computer & Informatics.

Undergraduate departments include Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Applied Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering, Civil Engineering, Applied Sciences, Chemical Engineering, Biotechnology, Food Technology, Computer Science and Engineering, Information Technology, and Electronic and Communications Engineering.

patterns: Cultural and non-academic activities at Haldia Institute of Technology
responses: HIT hosts the annual Science & Technology festival 'PRAYUKTI' and the yearly cultural festival 'RIVIERA' held in May-June.
Student life involves various cultural and non-academic activities, and students participate in clubs and festivals.

patterns: NIRF ranking of Haldia Institute of Technology in 2022
responses: HIT is ranked in the 251 - 300 band among engineering colleges in India by the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) in 2022.

patterns: How to get into Haldia Institute of Technology for B.Tech?
WBJEE and JEE(main) for HIT admission
responses: For B.Tech course, one has to clear the state-level entrance exam WBJEE or JEE(main) and JELET is the exam for 2nd-year lateral entry B.Tech course.

patterns: Average package in Chemical Engineering at HIT
responses: Haldia Institute of Technology (HIT) provides the best placement in the Chemical Engineering Department, with an average package of 8 - 9 LPA.
Our commitment to academic excellence and industry relevance ensures that our students secure rewarding opportunities in the field of Chemical Engineering.
